emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Code Review
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that autonomously review code for security vulnerabilities, performance issues, and best practices, integrating seamlessly with CI/CD pipelines.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error in code review, increases software reliability, but raises concerns about job automation in QA roles.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires robust AI training data and trust in AI decision-making; adoption will be driven by the need for faster development cycles.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Enhanced Neural Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Use of quantum computing to enhance the processing speed and accuracy of brain-computer interfaces, enabling more complex and real-time interactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for significant advancements in mental health treatment, but ethical concerns around privacy and consent are paramount.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High cost and complexity of quantum systems; ethical, privacy, and security issues need resolution before widespread adoption.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-Enabled Autonomous Vehicles
emerging_technologies.description: Vehicles that operate on blockchain technology for secure, transparent, and decentralized management of vehicle data, ownership, and insurance.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in autonomous systems through transparency and data security, but raises issues around data ownership and liability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on regulatory acceptance of blockchain for such critical applications and the resolution of technical challenges in real-time processing.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Collaborative Coding Environments
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced AI tools that not only suggest code but actively participate in coding sessions, providing real-time suggestions, code optimization, and debugging support.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in tech companies, with significant impact on software development speed and quality, but still requires human oversight for critical decisions.

mainstream_technologies.name: Energy Harvesting Urban Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Urban structures designed to capture and utilize ambient energy from solar, kinetic, and thermal sources to power public services.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in new urban developments, driven by sustainability goals and city planning initiatives.

epoch_themes.description: A focus on technologies that enhance human capabilities through AI, particularly in cognitive and physical tasks.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for cognitive enhancement, ethical debates over human vs. machine capabilities, and changes in labor markets.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in AI for healthcare, education, and personal productivity; global push for ethical AI frameworks.

epoch_themes.description: Innovations aimed at making cities more sustainable, resilient to climate change, and capable of energy self-sufficiency.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances urban living conditions, reduces environmental impact, but requires significant initial investment.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Urban planning prioritizing green technologies, international agreements on carbon neutrality, and smart city initiatives.
